# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (protected_characteristics) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.secureInfo_fact)
- **New Data:** where a Ref_No in the source does not exist as an ReligionCode in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Ref_No in source and SecureInfoID in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an SecureInfoID in the target exists but the same Ref_No doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View secureinfo_fact_new is created

%%sql  

-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW secureinfo_fact_new 

    AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.Ref_No IS NULL
        THEN T7.SecureInfoID
        ELSE NULL
    END as SecureInfoID, -- surrogate key
    T1.Ref_No AS SourceID, -- source system id
    T3.DisabilityID AS DisabilityID,
    T4.DiversityID AS DiversityID,
    T5.ReligionID AS ReligionID,
    T6.SXOID AS SXOID, 
    T2.SourceSystemID as SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from) AS IngestionDate,
    last_day(T1.expected_from) AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Ref_No,'.'), IFNULL(T3.DisabilityID,'.'), IFNULL(T4.DiversityID,'.'), IFNULL(T5.ReligionID,'.'), IFNULL(T6.SXOID,'.'))) as RowID,
    'Y' as IsActive,
    T7.IsActive as HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.vw_protected_characteristics T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_disability_dim T3 ON    T1.Disability_Text = T3.DisabilityCode  AND 
                                                    T1.Disability_Code_Description = T3.Description AND T3.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_diversity_dim T4 ON T1.Ethnic_Origin = T4.Description AND T4.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_religion_dim T5 ON  T1.Religion = T5.Description  AND 
                                                T1.Religious_Denomination_Key = T5.ReligionCode AND T5.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_sxo_dim T6 ON T1.SxO = T6.Description AND T6.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.hr_secure_info_fact T7 ON T1.Ref_No = T7.SourceID AND T7.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
    -- flags new data        
    (CASE
        WHEN T1.Ref_No = T7.SourceID AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.Ref_No,'.'), IFNULL(T3.DisabilityID,'.'), IFNULL(T4.DiversityID,'.'), IFNULL(T5.ReligionID,'.'), IFNULL(T6.SXOID,'.'))) <> T7.RowID    -- same employee, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T7.SourceID IS NULL -- new employee
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END  = 'Y')
    AND T1.Ref_No IS NOT NULL
;

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **secureinfo_fact_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View secureinfo_fact_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY  VIEW secureinfo_fact_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 

Select 

    SecureInfoID, -- surrogate key
    SourceID, -- source system id
    DisabilityID,
    DiversityID,
    ReligionID,
    SXOID, 
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From secureinfo_fact_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    SecureInfoID, -- surrogate key
    SourceID, -- source system id
    DisabilityID,
    DiversityID,
    ReligionID,
    SXOID, 
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_secure_info_fact
WHERE SourceID IN (SELECT SourceID FROM secureinfo_fact_new WHERE SecureInfoID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM secureinfo_fact_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW secureinfo_fact_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    T1.SecureInfoID,
    SourceID,
    DisabilityID,
    DiversityID,
    ReligionID,
    SXOID,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM secureinfo_fact_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View secureinfo_fact_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. Ref_No from Personal Characteristics), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised.secureinfo_fact is updated

%%sql
-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.hr_secure_info_fact AS Target
USING secureinfo_fact_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.SecureInfoID = Target.SecureInfoID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (SecureInfoID, 
        SourceID,
        DisabilityID,
        DiversityID,
        ReligionID,
        SXOID,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)  
        VALUES (Source.SecureInfoID,
        Source.SourceID, 
        Source.DisabilityID,
        Source.DiversityID,
        Source.ReligionID,
        Source.SXOID,
        Source.SourceSystemID, 
        Source.IngestionDate, 
        Source.ValidTo, 
        Source.RowID, 
        Source.IsActive) ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.secureinfo_fact is updated

%%sql

-- Insert new SecureInfoID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.hr_secure_info_fact 

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY SecureInfoID NULLS LAST) AS SecureInfoID, 
    SourceID, 
    DisabilityID,
    DiversityID,
    ReligionID,
    SXOID, 
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(ValidTo),
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.hr_secure_info_fact ;
